tuv.seg: Nullity of civil partnership
Neamhniú ar pháirtnéireacht shibhialta
Nullity of civil partnership is a declaration by a court that your supposed civil partnership is null and void, and that no valid civil partnership exists between you and your partner

Is forógra ó chúirt é neamhniú ar pháirtnéireacht shibhialta go bhfuil do pháirtnéireacht shibhialta cheaptha ar neamhní go hiomlán, agus nach maireann páirtnéireacht shibhialta idir tú agus do pháirtnéir
In other words, it is a declaration that the supposed civil partnership never happened
I bhfocail eile, is forógra é nár tharla an pháirtnéireacht shibhialta riamh
Nullity (or annulment) is not the same as dissolution
Níl neamhniú mar an gcéanna le díscaoileadh
Dissolution is a declaration ending a valid civil partnership
Is forógra é díscaoileadh ag cur críoch le páirtnéireacht shibhialta bhailí
Nullity is a declaration that a valid civil partnership never existed
Is forógra é neamhniú nár tharla an pháirtnéireacht shibhialta bhailí riamh
In nullity of marriage law, there are two types of marriages that may be annulled or cancelled
I ndlí neamhniú pósta, tá dhá chineál pósadh ar féidir iad a chur ar neamhní
There are void marriages and there are voidable marriages
Tá póstaí neamhnithe agus póstaí in-neamhnithe
If your marriage is void, it is regarded as never having taken place
Má tá do phósadh neamhnithe, féachfar air nár tharla sé riamh
If your marriage is voidable, it is considered to be a valid marriage until a decree of annulment is made
Má tá do phósadh in-neamhnithe, meastar gur pósadh bailí atá ann go dtí go ndéantar foraithne neamhnithe
In nullity of civil partnership law, there are only void civil partnerships
I ndlí neamhnithe pháirtnéireacht shibhialta, níl ann ach páirtnéireachtaí sibhialta neamhnithe
This means the civil partnerships are regarded as never having taken place
Ciallaíonn sé seo go bhféachfar ar na páirtnéireachtaí sibhialta nár tharla siad riamh
Technically, if your civil partnership never took place, then there is no need to go to court to obtain a decree of annulment - you may simply act as though the civil partnership never happened

Go teicniúil, murar tharla do pháirtnéireacht shibhialta riamh, níl aon ghá dul chun cúirte chun foraithne neamhnithe a fháil – is féidir leat díreach gníomhú ar nós nár tharla an pháirtnéireacht shibhialta riamh
However, it is advisable to obtain a court order declaring that your civil partnership is annulled in order to remove any doubt
Tá sé inmholta, áfach, ordú cúirte a fháil ag dearbhú go bhfuil do phairtnéireacht shibhialta curtha ar neamhní chun fáil réidh le haon amhras
A decree of annulment can only be made if one of the parties to the civil partnership applies to the court for a decree of nullity
Ní féidir foraithne neamhnithe a dhéanamh ach amháin má chuireann ceann den dá pháirtí isteach chuig an gcúirt ar fhoraithne neamhnithe
Any person whom the court believes has sufficient standing to do so may also apply
Is feidir le haon duine a cheapann an chúirt go bhfuil seasamh dóthanach aige chun é seo a dhéanamh cur isteach air
If the court decides that your civil partnership is void, it will then declare that your civil partnership never existed
Má chinneann an chúirt go bhfuil do pháirtnéireacht shibhialta neamhnithe, dearbhóidh sí ansin nach raibh do pháirtnéireacht shibhialta riamh ann
You can find out about the implications of a decree of nullity in our document on the consequences of an annulment of a civil partnership
Is féidir leat a fháil amach faoi na himpleachtaí atá ag foraithne neamhnithe inár gcáipéis ar chúinsí de neamhniú ar pháirtnéireacht shibhialta
In order to obtain an annulment (nullity) of your alleged civil partnership, you must make an application to the Circuit Court or the High Court
Chun neamnhiú a fháil ar do pháirtnéireacht shibhialta líomhnaithe, caithfidh tú iarratas a chur isteach chuig an gCúirt Chuarda nó an Chúirt Uachtarach
To prove to the court that your civil partnership is void you must show one of the following grounds:
Chun a chruthú don chúirt go bhfuil do pháirtnéireacht shibhialta neamhnithe caithfidh tú ceann de na forais a leanas a thaispeáint:
• At the time of the registration of the civil partnership there was a lack of capacity
• Ag am cláraithe an pháirtnéireacht shibhialta bhí easpa cumais
In other words, you or your parner was incapable of entering into a binding contract
I bhfocail eile, ní raibh sé ar do chumas nó ar chumas do pháirtnéara dul isteach i gconradh ceangailteach
- where one of you was already validly married or in a civil partnership or
- áit a raibh duine agaibh pósta go bailí cheana nó i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta nó
- where you were too closely related to each other or
- áit a raibh sibh róghar i ngaol lena chéile nó
- where you were of opposite biological sex or
- áit a raibh sibh ar ghnéis bhitheolaíochta dhifriúla nó
- where one of you was under 18 years of age
- áit a raibh duine agaibh faoi 18 bliain
• The formal requirements for the registration of a civil partnership were not followed
• Níor leanadh ceanglais fhoirmeálta do chlárú pháirtnéireacht shibhialta
For example, you did not give due notice to the civil registrar
Mar shampla, níor thug tú fógra dlite don gcláraitheoir sibhialta
• At the time of the registration of the civil partnership, there was a lack of consent
• Ag am cláraithe an phairtnéireacht shibhialta, bhí easpa comhthola ann
In other words, you or your partner did not give free and fully informed consent to the civil partnership
I bhfocail eile, níor thug tú ná do pháirtnéir comhthoil shaor agus láneolasach don pháirtnéireacht shibhialta
This may be due to duress, (i.e., you were forced into the civil partnership), mistake, misrepresentation or fraud
D’fhéadfaí gur mar gheall ar éigeantas (eadhon, cuireadh iallach ort dul isteach sa pháirtnéireacht shibhialta), botún, bréagléiriú nó calaois
It may also be due to the fact that you or your partner was suffering from a mental illness at that time
D’fhéadfaí freisin gur mar gheall ar an bhfíric go raibh tú féin nó do pháirtnéir ag fulaingt le meabhairghalar ag an am
Legal advice and representation is always advisable
Tá comhairle agus ionadaíocht dhlí inmholta i gcónaí
You and your partner should not use the same solicitor
Níor cheart duit féin na do pháirtnéir an t-aturnae céanna a úsáid
To enquire whether you are eligible for Legal Aid, you can contact your nearest law centre
Chun fiosrúcháin a dhéanamh maidir lena bhfuil tú incháilithe do Chúnamh Dlí, is féidir leat dul i dteagmháil leis an ionad dlí is gaire duit
Legal Aid is not free and everyone must pay a contribution towards costs
Níl Cúnamh Dlí saor in aisce agus caithfidh gach duine ranníocaícht a dhéanamh chuig costais
FLAC (Free Legal Advice Centres) is an independent, voluntary organisation that operates a network of legal advice clinics throughout the country
Is eagraíocht neamhspleách dheonach í ICDSA (Ionaid Chomhairle Dlí Saor in Aisce) a oibríonn líonra clinicí comhairle dlí ar fud na tíre
These clinics are confidential, free of charge and open to all
Tá na clinicí seo faoi rún, saor in aisce agus oscailte do gach duine
Contact your nearest Citizens Information Centre for information on FLAC services in your area
Téigh i dteagmháil leis an Ionad Eolais do Shaoránaigh is gaire duit d’eolas ar sheirbhísí ICDSA i do cheantar
FLAC also runs an information and referral line during office hours for basic legal information
Ritheann ICDSA líne eolais agus atreoraithe i rith uaireanta oifige d’eolas dlí bunúsach
If you choose to hire a private solicitor, you should be aware that there is no fixed rate of charges for legal fees
Má roghnaíonn tú aturnae príomhaideach a fhostú, ba cheart go mbeadh a fhios agat nach bhfuil aon ráta seasta do mhuirir do tháillí dlí
You are advised to obtain some quotes before deciding on a legal firm
Cuirtear comhairle ort roinnt luanna a fháil sula gcinneoidh tú ar ghnólacht dlí
Contact information for solicitors firms throughout Ireland is available on the Law Society website
Tá Eolas teagmhála do ghnólachtaí aturnaetha ar fud na hÉireann ar fáil ar shuíomh gréasáin Dhlí-Chumann na hÉireann
